item.title: Crew Oxygen System – Pressure Indication System (EICAS)

remarks.para: May be inoperative provided oxygen supply is verified to be above minimum required before each departure.

note.para: Observe maintenance requirements and verify bottle pressure prior to each takeoff.

placard.para: Placard near EICAS "02 PRESS INDICATION INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

numlitem.para: Verify system pressure at the gauge on the bottle.
Using the Crew Oxygen Minimum Dispatch Pressure chart, note dispatch pressure required for six crewmembers. Service bottle as necessary.
If bottle cannot be serviced and pressure is less than that required for six crewmembers, notify Flight Dispatch of number of crew that may be carried.

Bottle must be service to accommodate three crewmembers at all times. The first observer's seat must always be available for an FAA en route inspection and oxygen requirements are part of that availability.
